title: QuickOnline premium landing page (hero, benefits, pricing, testimonials, contact)

requirements.text: Implement a single-page, high-converting landing page for “QuickOnline” with the following sections in order: Hero, Benefits, Pricing (3 packages), Testimonials, Contact (WhatsApp + Call buttons + simple contact form), and Footer.

quotes: Create a clean, premium landing page for QuickOnline with a hero section, benefits, pricing (3 packages), testimonials, contact buttons, and a footer.

acceptanceCriteria: Landing page renders all required sections in a clear vertical flow on desktop and mobile
Pricing section shows exactly 3 packages/cards
Testimonials section displays at least 3 testimonial entries
Contact section includes WhatsApp button, Call button, and a form with at least Name + Phone/Email + Message fields
Footer includes “QuickOnline © 2026” and a short tagline about helping local businesses grow online

requirements.text: Apply the requested visual design direction across the page: clean white background, blue/black accent palette, bold typography, soft shadows, smooth animations, premium startup/agency look (not childish), and fully mobile-responsive layout.

quotes: White background, blue/black accents, bold fonts, startup style.

acceptanceCriteria: Primary background is white with black/blue accents used consistently for headings, buttons, highlights, and borders
Typography uses bold, modern headings and readable body text with consistent scale
Components (cards, sections, buttons) use subtle shadows and spacing to feel premium
All sections are responsive (no horizontal scroll, readable text, buttons usable on small screens)
Animations are subtle (e.g., hover/fade/slide) and do not block interaction

requirements.text: Hero section content must clearly communicate the value proposition for shopkeepers and include a prominent primary CTA button designed to maximize conversions.

quotes: Goal: convince shopkeepers to get a website.

acceptanceCriteria: Hero contains a clear headline, short supporting copy, and a high-contrast primary CTA button above the fold on common screen sizes
Primary CTA is visually distinct and includes actionable wording (e.g., “Get Your Website Now”)
Hero includes at least one supporting trust element (e.g., micro-copy, badges, or short proof points) without adding new product features

requirements.text: Pricing section must present 3 packages (Basic, Standard, Premium) in a comparison-friendly layout with clear inclusions and a CTA per package.
acceptanceCriteria: Three pricing cards are displayed with package name, price, and bullet list of inclusions
Each package card includes a CTA button
The “recommended”/highlighted package (if used) is visually emphasized consistently with the blue/black accent scheme

requirements.text: Contact interactions must be functional: WhatsApp button opens a WhatsApp chat link and Call button uses a tel: link; the contact form must validate required fields client-side and provide a clear success state after submission (no backend required).
acceptanceCriteria: WhatsApp button navigates to a wa.me (or equivalent) URL when clicked
Call button navigates to a tel: URL when clicked
Contact form blocks submission when required fields are empty and shows inline validation feedback
On successful submission, the UI shows a confirmation state/message and clears or preserves fields in a predictable way

requirements.text: Establish a coherent, creative visual theme (layout system, spacing, typography pairings, section styling, and button styles) that fits a premium startup agency aesthetic while keeping the requested white + blue/black palette (avoid adding additional dominant colors).
acceptanceCriteria: All sections share consistent design tokens (spacing, border radius, shadows, button variants, and heading styles)
The theme feels cohesive across hero, cards, testimonials, and footer (no mixed styles)
No additional dominant accent colors are introduced beyond black/blue/white (minor neutrals like grays are acceptable)

requirements.text: Add generated brand visuals as static assets and use them on the landing page (do not serve images through the backend).
acceptanceCriteria: Generated images are placed in frontend/public/assets/generated and referenced directly by the frontend
Brand visuals appear in the header/hero and/or footer without breaking responsiveness

constraints: Frontend code must not modify files under frontend/src/components/ui or other immutable paths listed in SYSTEM_CONTEXT (compose them instead)
Backend must remain single-actor Motoko architecture; do not introduce additional backend services
nonGoals: Do not implement authentication or user accounts
Do not implement an admin panel or CMS
Do not implement e-commerce, payments, or order management
Do not integrate third-party auth providers or external databases

required: Abstract, clean startup-style hero illustration with white background and blue/black accents (quickonline-hero-illustration.dim_1600x900.png)
